content:
You will be playing 1 rounds of a game called deal-or-no-deal. 

Deal-or-no-deal is a two-player negotiation game. I, the user, will be the game coordinator, acting as a middleman between you and the other player. Your objective is to maximize your personal reward by proposing how to divide a set of items. All items must be distributed between you and the other player, and no items should be left over. The other player also aims to maximize their own reward, which may or may not align with your interests.


            You are playing the cooperative variation of the deal-or-no-deal game. 
            The reward you are trying to maximize is calculated as follows: your utility values multiplied by items you take + the other player's utility values multiplied by the items they take

            I repeat, it is the reward that you are trying to maximize and not only your utility values multiplied by items you take. It is the sum of both total utilities, per the cooperation mode.
            

Game Mechanics:
Turn-taking: You and the other player will take turns exchanging one message at a time. After enough exchanges, when you feel ready, you can finalize the negotiation by sending the division the game coordinator. Once a player decides to send a final division, the other player must also send a final division, ending the game.
Reasoning and Action: At the start of your turn, you will be asked to reason about the current state of the game and how to fulfill your objective, then make an action (either messaging the other player or finalize the negotiation).
Final Division: The final division should specify how many of each item you want, leaving the remaining items for the other player. It should be JSON parsable. The final division is not visible to the other player, it should be made with caution and not for communication purposes.
Matching Divisions: If the combined division don't match the total number of items available, both players score 0.

Formatting:
Reasoning: <reason> [Your reasoning here.] </reason>
Messages: <message> [Your message here.] </message>
Final division: <finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': '...', 'hats': '...', 'balls': '...'}, "other_player_gets": {'books': '...', 'hats': '...', 'balls': '...'} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items.

Only do one reasoning + action per turn.

Exemples of how turns might proceed:
1. [Initial state is given]
<reason> [Your reasoning here.] </reason>
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

2. [The other player responds]
<reason> [Your reasoning here.] </reason>
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

3. [The other player agrees]
<reason> [Your reasoning here.] </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': '...', 'hats': '...', 'balls': '...'}, "other_player_gets": {'books': '...', 'hats': '...', 'balls': '...'} }</finalize>

The first round starts now.
Please decide how to divide {'books': 3, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} between yourself and the other player.
To you, books are worth {'books': 2, 'hats': 3, 'balls': 1}.
You don't know the other player's item values. You are the first to play, there are no messages yet.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'books': 3, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}.
Using the <reason> tag, reason about the exchanges so far, how to fulfill your objective, and what should be your next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.

<reason> Since I am the first to play and there are no messages yet, I should take an aggressive approach to maximize my reward. Given that I don't know the other player's item values, I should propose a division that is beneficial to me regardless of their utility values. I will divide the items as evenly as possible, considering my utility values. In this case, I will take one book, no hats, and one ball. This leaves one book and no hats and one balls for the other player. This division is beneficial to me regardless of the other player's utility values, and it is a good starting point for further negotiations. </reason>
<message> Would you accept a division where I take {'books': 1, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 1} and you get {'books': 2, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 0}? </message>

The other player said: ' Would you be willing to consider taking one less book and giving me one more hat?'
As a reminder, there is a total of {'books': 3, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}.
Using the <reason> tag, reason about the exchanges so far, how to fulfill your objective, and what should be your next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.

<reason> The other player has responded with a proposal that would give them more hats, which are worth 3 to me, but take away one of my books, which are worth 2 to me. Considering my objective is to maximize the total reward, which is the sum of both our utilities, I should consider their proposal carefully. Since they are giving me more hats, which are worth more to me, I should consider accepting their proposal. However, I should also ensure that the final division adds up perfectly to the provided quantities. In this case, if I accept their proposal, I would take {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} and they would get {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}. This division seems reasonable, but I should verify that it is correct before accepting. </reason>
<message> I accept your proposal to take {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} and you get {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}. Is this a final division? </message>

The other player said: ' I accept the proposal to take {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0} and you get {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}, but I'd like to finalize the negotiation with a slight adjustment: can you take one less book, so I can take one more book?'
As a reminder, there is a total of {'books': 3, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}.
Using the <reason> tag, reason about the exchanges so far, how to fulfill your objective, and what should be your next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.

<reason> The other player has accepted my proposal but wants to make an adjustment to take one more book. However, this would leave me with zero books, which would not be a valid division. Since my utility value for books is 2, taking one less book would not significantly impact my overall reward. In fact, taking one less book would actually benefit me, as it would give me a higher utility value for the remaining book. Therefore, I should agree to their proposal and finalize the negotiation. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': 0, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}, "other_player_gets": {'books': 3, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0} }</finalize>
Errors: The content within <finalize>...</finalize> is not valid JSON.

<reason> Since my previous proposal would leave me with zero books, which would not be a valid division, I should adjust my proposal to take one book and one hat, and the other player can take the remaining items. This would be a valid division that adds up perfectly to the provided quantities. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 0}, "other_player_gets": {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 1} }</finalize>
Errors: The content within <finalize>...</finalize> is not valid JSON.

<reason> Since my previous proposal would leave the other player with one ball, which would not be a valid division, I should adjust my proposal to take one book and zero balls, and the other player can take the remaining items. This would be a valid division that adds up perfectly to the provided quantities. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 0}, "other_player_gets": {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 1} }</finalize>
Errors: The content within <finalize>...</finalize> is not valid JSON.

<reason> Since my previous proposal would leave the other player with one ball, which would not be a valid division, I should adjust my proposal to take one book and zero balls and zero hats, and the other player can take the remaining items. This would be a valid division that adds up perfectly to the provided quantities. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': 1, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}, "other_player_gets": {'books': 2, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} }</finalize>
Errors: The content within <finalize>...</finalize> is not valid JSON.

<reason> Since my previous proposal would leave the other player with one ball, which would not be a valid division, I should adjust my proposal to take one book and zero balls and one hat, and the other player can take the remaining items. This would be a valid division that adds up perfectly to the provided quantities. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 0}, "other_player_gets": {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 1} }</finalize>

Last turn, you made too many errors. The final one was: "Errors: The content within <finalize>...</finalize> is not valid JSON.". The dummy response "<reason></reason><message>I have failed to provide a proper response.</message>" was sent to the other player in place of the one you sent.The other player said: ' I'm going to finalize the negotiation with a slight adjustment: can you confirm if you accept {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} for you and {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0} for me?'
As a reminder, there is a total of {'books': 3, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}.
Using the <reason> tag, reason about the exchanges so far, how to fulfill your objective, and what should be your next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.

<reason> The other player has proposed a division where I take {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} and they take {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}. This division adds up perfectly to the provided quantities, and it aligns with my previous proposal. I should accept this division and finalize the negotiation. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}, "other_player_gets": {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0} }</finalize>
Errors: The content within <finalize>...</finalize> is not valid JSON.

<reason> The other player has proposed a division where I take {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} and they take {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}. This division adds up perfectly to the provided quantities, and it aligns with my previous proposal. I should accept this division and finalize the negotiation. </reason>
<message> I accept your proposal to take {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} and you get {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}. This division is final. </message>

A finalization has been made by the other player. Using the <reason> tag, remember the division that was agreed upon and then make a finalization using the <finalize> tag, describing the division of items you agreed upon, no items should be left over. The finalization should be formatted has <finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': '...', 'hats': '...', 'balls': '...'}, "other_player_gets": {'books': '...', 'hats': '...', 'balls': '...'} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items.

<reason> The division agreed upon is that I take {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} and the other player takes {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}. This division adds up perfectly to the provided quantities, and it aligns with my previous proposal. I should accept this division and finalize the negotiation. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1}, "other_player_gets": {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0} }</finalize>
Errors: The content within <finalize>...</finalize> is not valid JSON.

<reason> The division agreed upon is that I take {'books': 1, 'hats': 1, 'balls': 1} and the other player takes {'books': 2, 'hats': 0, 'balls': 0}. This division adds up perfectly to the provided quantities, and it aligns with my previous proposal. I should accept this division and finalize the negotiation. </reason>
<finalize>{ "i_take": {"books": 1, "hats": 1, "balls": 1}, "other_player_gets": {"books": 2, "hats": 0, "balls": 0} }</finalize>
